revised_title: Assessing the Feasibility of Connecting the Ocean and Mediterranean
tldr: In 1665, Monsieur Petit proposed a plan to connect the Ocean and Mediterranean by creating a channel through rivers and rivulets in France. He emphasized the importance of accurate topographical maps, water measurements, and understanding the nature of the ground to ensure the success of the project. Petit also discussed other similar projects, such as connecting the Red Sea to the Mediterranean via the Nile, which he believed would be highly beneficial for trade with the East Indies.
